bio: Ramakrishna Ghosh, a promising right-arm medium-fast bowler from India, has been making waves in the domestic circuit with his impressive performances. Ghosh has quickly established himself as a key player for Maharashtra in the Ranji Trophy. His bowling prowess was on full display during the 2024/25 season, where he took 11 wickets in just six matches, showcasing an average of 41.45 and an economy rate of 3.70. His best performance came against Odisha, where he claimed 3-50, demonstrating his knack for breaking partnerships and providing crucial breakthroughs. Ghosh's journey in the domestic T20 circuit has been equally noteworthy. In the Maharashtra Premier League 2024, he emerged as a standout performer, taking 20 wickets in 15 matches at an average of 17.20. His best figures of 4-30 against Jain Irrigation highlighted his ability to dominate in the shorter format. With a strike rate of 12.55, Ghosh has proven to be a reliable wicket-taker, capable of turning the tide of a match with his incisive spells. In the IPL, Ghosh was acquired by the Chennai Super Kings for the 2025 season at his base price of INR 30 lacs, marking his arrival to India's premier T20 league. He he has had the opportunity to learn from some of the best in the business. Although he is yet to make his mark in the IPL, his performances in domestic leagues suggest that it is only a matter of time before he becomes a regular feature in the tournament.
